MS MCQs

    Manage and secure Microsoft Teams meetings

    »

    1. When configuring meeting policies, how does a per-organizer policy work?

      The per-organizer policy applies only to meeting organizers.

      The per-organizer policy applies to meeting organizers and meeting participants.

      The per-organizer policy applies only to meeting participants.


    2. What’s required for a meeting participant to start a meeting recording?

      The participant has an assigned policy with Allow cloud recording set to On, and they’re part of the same organization.

      The participant has an assigned policy with Allow IP video set to On, and they’re part of the same organization.

      The participant has an assigned policy with Allow cloud recording and Allow IP video, and is an external user.


    3. When should you create a custom meeting policy?

      When you want to prevent all users from creating transcriptions of meetings.

      When you want to prevent everyone except users who work in Marketing from creating transcriptions of meetings.

      When you want to prevent guests joining meetings for your organization.


    4. Your organization doesn’t have a Microsoft Stream license. How long are meeting recordings stored?

      Indefinitely, or until they’re deleted.

      The time a recording is stored is set in the meetings policy.

      For 20 days.
